data.name: Amber
data.description: Okay - we're going to say it: beer isn't always about the hops. Ales like our Amber are more about getting a sweet, roasty and malty taste. This is London-style brew is no exception. Dark with a caramel aroma, the Alley Kat Amber focuses on the subtle tastes in every sip.
data.foodPairings: meats and cheeses, antipasti platter, genoa salami, kalamata olives, provolone

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: Alley Kat Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Alley Kat Brewing Company is a craft brewery that's mission is to produce oustandingly flavourful, fresh tasting beer of exceptional quality.

Longest running microbrewery in Edmonton and the fourth oldest brewery in Alberta.

data.name: Amber
data.description: Our rendition of a pacific northwest classic. Brewed with six different kinds of malt for a deep complex malt profile and balanced with three additions of Cascade and Mt. Hood hops. This ale has and enjoyable fruity citrus finish

data.name: Amber Ale
data.description: Boasting two gold medals, our hoppier, more malty American take on the English Extra Special Bitter—ESB—pleases even the most discerning beer connoisseurs and particularly those who like a big, bold beer. Lightning Founder and head brewer Dr. James Crute has brewed this beer with devotion for over 25 years. When the wind drives you indoors on a cold night, raise a pint with friends and enjoy its balance and drinkability. You’ll marvel at the tall cream-colored head topping off this dark amber beer. With a higher ABV than its British cousin, our Amber Ale is a true “sipping session” ale.
data.foodPairings: Red meat, Grilled steaks, smoked meat, pork, spicy Indian cuisine, Pacific Rim sushi, All American fare.

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale

breweries.name: Lightning Brewery
breweries.description:
Our fine hand crafted European style beers have a distinctive Lightning Finish: a crisp, clean aroma, pronounced maltiness and a prolonged and slightly bittering finish. Our beers are good to drink on their own, and great with food. We have proven that you don’t need to travel to Europe to enjoy beers of these styles and of this caliber!

At Lightning we brew “Better Beer Through Science.” We believe that good beer can be the result of chance and that great beer is the result of an in-depth understanding of the beer making process. We take care to control each stage of the brewing cycle, never skimp on how long each step takes and only use the highest quality ingredients: malted barley, hops, yeast, plus a healthy dose of science.

breweries.name: Ghost River Brewing
breweries.description:
In 1887, Memphis first tapped the now famous Memphis Sands Aquifer. Recharged by the Ghost River's fragile wetlands, the aquifer has supplied Memphis with a steady and consistent supply of excellent drinking water ever since.

Ghost River Brewing knows that "great water makes great beer." And some of the greatest drinking water on earth is available right here in west Tennessee.

Brewing locally guarantees that every handcrafted, full-flavored Ghost River Ale is the freshest beer available . . . and when it comes to flavor, freshness means everything!

Ghost River Brewing supports the Wolf River Conservancy by donating a portion of the proceeds of every barrel sold.

Help Ghost River Brewing and the Wolf River Conservancy protect our local, natural resources and the quality of our famous drinking water

data.name: Amber Ale
data.description: A gorgeous amber color - medium hops and malt flavors with slightly fruity overtones, JUST RIGHT. Our Amber Ale is brewed with all American ingredients, making it a perfect pairing for most foods

breweries.name: SunUp Brewing
breweries.description:
The seven barrel system that looms behind the floor to ceiling glass in our Brewer’s Den is the fruits of our labor and February 14, 2006 marked a new chapter in our history. You see, this was the day that the first three beers brewed on site flowed. We know we are biased, but in our minds the beer had never tasted as good as it did that day. Our brew master is the “Big German” Uwe Boer that we all know and love. He works magic in his craft and the passion that he shows for brewing fills the glasses as his award winning beer dispenses from our taps. We now boast our own regular taps but his innovation in our seasonal ales and distinct brewing style is what keeps our bar stools full and the place hopping. We can hardly keep his cask conditioned ale on tap as our customers are known to consume the kegs in record time.

“Great Beer, Great Food and Great Service” became our motto as we plugged through the first few years and now the slogan is what we live by. Our fantastic customers and great staff are what makes us who we are and how we stand out in the sea of new restaurants that pop up daily. It is our great customers that made it so easy to push forward into brewing and our loyal staff that helped to smooth over the transition. We continue to grow and change over time just as any business wants to do but it is remembering the little things that have gotten us to where we are today. After all in today’s crazy hectic world it is the little things in life that make it all worth it.

breweries.name: Vierling Restaurant & Marquette Harbor Brewery
breweries.description: In December 1995, the Vierling became one of Michigan’s first brew pubs with the addition of a five barrel micro-brewing system.  The brew equipment, direct from Budapest, Hungary is configured to produce some of the finest ales and lagers in 155 gallon hand-crafted batches.  The relatively small sized batches of beer insures a fast product turn-over which enables the Vierling to serve the freshest beer possible with a multitude of varieties.

data.name: Amber Ale
data.description: The malts used give this ale its amber hue and notes of caramel flavor. This refreshing brew has complex and somewhat fruity flavor due to the esters given off by the yeast.

breweries.name: Rohrbach Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Rohrbach Brewing Company has been brewing handcrafted ales and lagers in Rochester for over a decade! Loyal Rohrbach customers from near and far continue to prove that there is a market for premium high quality lagers and ales.

All of our ales and lagers are made with only the finest ingredients available worldwide; two-row malted barley from Belgium and the freshest hops from Europe and the Pacific Northwest . Our lagers and ales are delivered cold and fresh, with no artificial preservatives or flavor deteriorating pasteurization, which insures that your customers enjoy them at their peak freshness.

breweries.name: Bare Bones Brewery
breweries.description: Bare Bones Brewery is located on the beautiful north side of Oshkosh, just off the scenic Wiouwash Trail. With his many years of experience, the brewmaster will be brewing up delicious hand-crafted beers throughout the year. Local flavor abounds at the brewery, as the guest taps and spirits are all made in Wisconsin. Visitors can enjoy tours, tastings and monthly beer tasting bike rides (weather permitting, of course) at Bare Bones Brewery. If you are hungry, the brewery offers food, such as pizzas and pretzels, or, if you choose, you can carry-in or have something delivered.

data.name: Amber Ale
data.description: Amber Ale deftly balances a mixture of toasted grain & light caramel notes with a range of floral, citrus and herbal hop notes, capped by a clean bitterness. This balance of flavors makes Amber Ale quite versatile as a food pairing option, not to mention being rather tasty in its own right. Whether serving as a jumping point to other styles or as a familiar standby, Amber Ale is central to the Bell’s portfolio.
data.foodPairings:
The food beer; most cooking processes (grilling, broiling, sauteing and deep frying) create caramelized flavors that pair extremely well with Amber Ale including chicken, seafood, burgers, Jambalaya and spicy cuisine.

For dessert, pair with poached pears with dulce de leche, banana pound cake or pecan lace cookies.

Pairs well with cheeses like Port Salut, Spanish blue and 3-year-old Grafton.

Looking for a perfect beer to serve during Thanksgiving dinner? Amber Ale goes really well with turkey and stuffing.

breweries.name: Bell's Brewery, Inc.
breweries.description: Bell's Brewery, Inc. began in 1985 with a quest for better beer and a 15 gallon soup kettle. Since then, we've grown into a regional craft brewery that employs more than 200 people over an 20 state area, in addition to Puerto Rico and Washington DC. The dedication to brewing flavorful, unfiltered, quality craft beers that started in 1985 is still with us today. We currently brew over 20 beers for distribution as well as many other small batch beers that are served at our pub in Kalamazoo, the Eccentric Cafe. Our ongoing goal is to brew thoughtfully, creatively and artistically. We strive to bring an authentic and pleasant experience to all of our customers through our unique ales and beers.

breweries.name: Railroad City Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We are an artisan nanobrewery offering a selection of fine ales, each handcrafted in a small batch. Our products will rotate pretty heavily, but we will always have at least 3-4 beers available, and something for most tastes.

Upon our opening we will be only the second brewery in Blair County and the FIRST brewery in the City of Altoona since the 1970s.

Our beers will be available at finer establishments in the area and directly from our tasting room where you can sample beers, and purchase growler fills and merchandise. We will begin offering some bottled products in the fall of 2013.

data.name: Amber Ale
data.description: Our Amber Ale is medium body, medium bitter, and medium malty but far from mediocre.  Not too sweet, not too bitter, one taste and you'll see it is purley drinkable.  This ale is red in color with a caramel richness and a balance more towards malt than hops.

breweries.name: Flathead Lake Brewing Company
breweries.description: Flathead Lake Brewing Co. was established in 2004 on the east shore of Flathead Lake in Woods Bay, Montana and is home to handcrafted award winning beers, excellent food and spectacular views. Stop by our world class tasting room for one of our beers and sit back and enjoy the incredible mountain and lake views. It is a Montana experience to remember. Flathead Lake Brewing Co. was established in 2004 with a kitchen added in  March of 2010. FLBC endeavors to provide the highest quality product (all natural, unfiltered, and full of flavor) and customer satisfaction while supporting a responsible beer culture... “Quality Montana Lifestyle, crafted and brewed in the Flathead Valley”. The Brewery features ten premier award winning quality crafted brews as well as seasonal offerings. In addition to our focus on product quality, FLBC creates a positive experience for our customers by offering more than a great brewpub where people can come to relax and converse over great food and beer. It offers a place where people can come to learn more about the beer and the brewing process.

breweries.name: Brew Wërks Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Founded in 2011, our passion for great beer has driven us to carve out a niche wherever possible as we strive to bring our own sense of innovation to a very informed local beer consumer. We recognize that the bar has been set high, and we are excited by the opportunity to earn your admiration amongst so many great breweries.

We strive to make beers that push the boundaries of common conception, bursting with flavors and aromas that encourage brew fans to relish in the lush sensory experience. Unfiltered and unrefined, our lineup is designed to encourage the drinker to embrace change as our robust signature mouth feel stretches the palate beyond its previous expectation.

breweries.description: At Pitcher's Brewery we proudly serve handcrafted ales using the finest grains, hops, yeast and water to produce a quality product. Our original fresh craft brews contain influences from Belgium, Canada, English, German as well as America.

data.name: Amber Ale
data.description:
Stunning in color, perhaps our most beautiful looking beer. Yeast and hops take the backseat as malt shines with a crisp, biscuity zing. Flaked rye gives the impression of toasted rye toast and candied pecans. Sitting at a very sessionable strength, the Deliberation Amber is perfect for when you want more than one.

Malts: 2 row, Cara,
Melanoidin, Victory,
Flaked Rye, Dextrin 
Hops: Cascade, Palisade 
Yeast: House Ale

breweries.name: West Sixth Brewing
breweries.description:
West Sixth Brewing founders Ben, Brady, Joe, and Robin all came to the same conclusion at about the same time – Lexington, KY needs more high quality local craft beer. Since we came from very different backgrounds with diverse sets of experiences and talents, we joined forces to create beer that can be enjoyed not only by craft beer experts, but also by those who just want something tasty to drink after going for a bike ride.

Though we all got to this point in our lives in different ways, we strongly agree on West Sixth’s goals. We will provide a taproom and beer garden where the beer list is never the same but that is always local. We will be a brewery that measures its success not only by making great craft beer but also by how it helps our community. We will always strive to protect our environment even if it costs us more to do so. And last, but not least, we all share a desire to create the best beer possible and to be an integral part of building a great beer culture for our great town.

data.name: Amber Ale
data.description: Reddish amber in color, our amber has a malty aroma and a caramel and toffee malt flavor. Citrusy American hops balance out the malt flavor, keeping it from being too sweet and adding a moderate amount of bitterness. Amber Ale is a Seasonal and contains 5.1% ABV.

breweries.name: Kirkwood Station Brewing Company
breweries.description: Kirkwood Station Restaurant and Brewing Co. is located just a block north of the historic train station in beautiful downtown Kirkwood Missouri, a southwest suburb of St. Louis. Established in 2009, we are building a tradition of taste, quality, service and charm. With our award winning craft beer, exceptional food, and fabulous live music, the focus is on our guests and great times! Sit back with friends and enjoy the wonderful food and craft beer as you play billiards, throw darts, watch the game, or dance the night away. Whether it’s a small gathering or a party of 275 guests, Kirkwood Station wants you to enjoy the ride.

breweries.name: Peak Organic Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Peak is a small craft brewing company dedicated to making delicious, handcrafted ales using only the finest artisanal ingredients.

With roots in home brewing back in the 90s, brewer Jon Cadoux set about combining his love for beer with an ethic for sustainability. Whenever possible, he would go out and find ingredients from local organic farmers for his homebrews.  It was a defining day when Jon discovered that you don’t need to sacrifice flavor for sustainability, but that better ingredients actually made the beer more delicious.

breweries.name: BAD Brewing Co
breweries.description: BAD Brewing Company is a small Microbrewery locatedin downtown Mason, MI that opened in the Summer of 2012. We will offer a wide selection of hand crafted beers. We will have at least five house beers on tap, with several more on a rotating basis. All of the beers are hand crafted on site by the owner, and new recipes are always in the works! BAD Brewing looks forward to serving Mason and the Greater Lansing area the finest hand crafted beers possible. Have a BAD day!

breweries.name: Crow Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Crow Brewing is a Southern California based brewing company pioneering locally produced 100% organic high quality craft beer. We focus on West Coast style ales and lagers using the highest quality organic malts and hops. We are headquartered in San Diego County and our beer is currently being produced in Orange County. We are back to looking for a brewery site.

CROW BREWING~ Great beer that happens to be organic.

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. breweries.name: Deepwater Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Deep Water Brewing Co. is our very own three barrel microbrewery.  While the actual brewery is currently off site in Brooklin, it will soon be located behind the Arborvine.

At Deep Water we personally handcraft each and every beer from the best ingredients available. Right now, we serve our beers exclusively at the Arborvine and the Vinery.

Being small allows us to experiment. We brew a number of styles and try to keep them rotating throughout the summer.

Primarily, we brew ales, namely: Pale Ale, Double IPA, Amber Ale, Porter, Oatmeal Stout (coming soon), and British mild.

For special occasions, though, we have been known to break out a keg of lager or two.  In the past we've served: Bohemian Pilsner and Octoberfest (Marzen).  Sometime this summer we will debut our Vienna Lager.

data.name: Amber Ale
data.description:
A medium bodied copper-colored ale that shows notable caramel malt flavor with moderate hop bitterness along with a hint of fruit.

Brain of Brewers 2010 Bronze Medal.

We offer our own freshly brewed handcrafted ales and lagers, including seasonal and other specialty brews.  All Standing Stone Ales are made here at the brewery in ten barrel batches using over 80% organic malts.

data.name: Amber Ale
data.description:
Description:

Rich Weyermann Munich Malts balance American 2 Row Malt with some color provided by the less sweet English and German Crystal malts. The beautiful malty character is balanced with a light addition of American Centennial to provide a true American style Amber.

breweries.name: Blue Pants Brewery
breweries.description:
Blue Pants Brewery was born out of a love of craft beer and craft beer culture. This first brewery is meant to be a gateway to the second and an inspiration to other small brewers that it can be done on this scale with a healthy amount of hard work. We’ve already had phone calls and emails from other brewers who are planning to follow in our footsteps, and we provide any help that we can. 

The Brewery will consist of a 1.5 Barrel (or about 45 gallon) brewing system. Initially, distribution will be in 1/4 Barrel kegs to bars around the area, draft only. All the beer will be keg conditioned prior to distribution to ensure that it is at its maximum freshness, finishing the fermentation the moment it is loaded on a refridgerated truck out of the brewery.

data.name: Amber Ale
data.description: Boulevard Amber Ale is an exceptionally well-balanced beer, complex yet thirst-quenching. American pale malt provides a firm foundation. English specialty malts impart a nutty sweetness, perfectly complemented by noble German hops. The deep coppery color holds the light, reflecting a ruddy glow, and the finish is clean, round, and delicious.

breweries.name: Boulevard Brewing Company
breweries.description: Welcome to Boulevard Brewing Company, the Midwest's home for fine ales and lagers since 1989. Boulevard's mission is simple: to produce fresh, flavorful beers using the finest traditional ingredients and the best of both old and new brewing techniques.

data.name: Amber Ale
data.description: Our Amber Ale is medium bodied with a subtly sweet malt character in the aroma. It is a faithful adaption of the American Amber style with enhanced complexity and richness due to our use of seven different types of malt and four unique varieties of hops. With its full malt profile and a soft hop character, this Amber Ale is rich and balanced.

data.name: Amber Ale
data.description:
A deep reddish-brown ale with medium to full body and a lively hop character.  This is a much fuller style than most amber ales.  The hops make this beer particularly refreshing, especially for a darker style.  The flavor is rich enough to stand on its own, but also goes extremely well with pastas and spicy food.

Columbus, Amarillo and Cascade hops
First wort hopping

Pale 2-Row, Crystal, Munich, Chocolate 
and Carastan malts

breweries.name: Boundary Bay Brewery
breweries.description:
The Boundary Bay approach to beer is to render excellent examples of classic styles. In some cases--such as with our IPA, Imperial IPA and Imperial Oatmeal Stout--we push the envelope and make a very big and flavorful brew. Put simply, we brew the beers that we like to drink! 

We are located in the heart of downtown Bellingham, WA and have been dubbed "Pure Bellingham" by the locals!  We continually win awards for our beer, have been named one of the top 25 breweries in the U.S. (by Steve Johnson, America's Best Brews), were declared the Best Brewery in WA (by the Northwest Brewing News Reader's Poll 2005, 2008, 2009 and 2010) and are the only brewery in Washington to bring home the Alpha King award for our Imperial IPA.

Come have a pint with us.  Cheers!

breweries.name: WT Brews
breweries.description:
WT Brews is a microbrewery located in Baldwinsville, NY.

As a New York State Farm Brewery we put our focus on local ingredients to hand craft all of our beers, including growing our own hops here at our farm, WT Acres.

We pride ourselves in brewing high quality, hand crafted beer that supports our local agriculture and community and showcases the best of New York.

Flag-beer of the Negev Brewery.

Its color is reddish to amber, the capital is beautifully balanced, with the tastes of the roasted caramel malt, along with a bitter ending, found traditionally in the Eyal Amber.

With a fruity aroma, medium body and a pleasant vmogzot, suitable for any situation.

Negev Amber Ale is great for chicken, fish and seafood vlkinohi Leche, mini nuts and bananas

data.name: Amber Ale
data.description: Truly our flagship beer, this Amber has been brewed since we opened, and it remains a top choice among craft drinkers. Back when we opened the brewery, the only "microbrews" available in the area were Sam Adam's Boston Lager and Sierra Nevada's Pale Ale. This beer is Ed and Louis' design to create a flavor that was somewhere in the middle yet also very unique.
data.foodPairings: This beer pairs well with a wide range of dishes. Its dry finish will help clean your palate after savory Southern dishes, smoky BBQ, and cheese courses. It also pairs well with chocolate chip cookies and dessert pastries.

breweries.name: Palmetto Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Opened by Ed Falkenstein and Louis Bruce in 1993 to create a locally-brewed alternative to domestic and import beers, Palmetto is South Carolina's oldest brewery and the first to open in the state since Prohibition. We make four year-round styles of beer, with every batch brewed in our twenty-five barrel brewing system.

Ed and Louis started making great beers after a windsurfing trip to Hood River Oregon. After finding inspiration and realizing that Charleston needed some better beer, they set up shop on Huger Street and have been brewing up trouble ever since. 

Wanna come see us?

Tasting Room hours are:
Tues-Thurs 3pm - 9pm
Fri-Sat 1pm - 10pm

breweries.name: Barrel Trolley Brewing
breweries.description:
Barrel Trolley Beer harkens back to the days of secret handshakes and a flourishing underground world. During the days of prohibition when revelers crowded into hidden saloons, getting a beer was a clandestine process — the result of sharing a discreet password or speaking softly to avoid detection. Bootleggers flourished as they stealthily transported the prized cargo to thirsty revelers!
 
Using a seamless network of tracks, the covert trolley system of the 1920s was a bootleggers dream. This transport system was the ticket to an American revolution and the revolt against Prohibition. As the trolley’s connected underground speakeasies, mobsters teamed with bootleggers to distribute barrels of their precious brew. In a tribute to those brave soldiers of salvation, we bring you Barrel Trolley Pale Ale, Amber Ale, IPA, Nut Brown Ale and Belgian White Ale.

data.name: Amber Ale
data.description: A style without definition, amber ales range from bland, vaguelly caramelly beers to products with a fairly healthy malt and hop balance. Often the differentiation between a quality amber and an American Pale is that the amber might have more dark malt character, or a less assertive hop rate.

breweries.name: Old 690 Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Old 690 Brewing Company is one of the first farm breweries to open in the state of Virginia. Our mission is to brew and serve a unique yet balanced variety of fresh craft beers including several seasonal ales that utilize crops grown on the 10 acre property. Come out to beautiful Loudoun County to see our hops and enjoy our unique tasting room Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays where we serve tasting flights, pints and growlers to go. We have food trucks all weekend, but feel free to bring your own food. We are also family, kid and dog friendly. We also make and serve our own root beer!

If you are interested in hosting a special, private or corporate event please contact events@old690.com. Special event hours are available 7 days a week pending availability.

Looking forward to seeing you soon at Old 690!!

data.name: Amber Ale
data.description: Light amber color, this superbly balanced beer is medium bodied with a fresh hop bouquet and a crisp honey like finish.

breweries.name: No-Li Brewhouse
breweries.description:
If Spokane were a liquid it would most certainly be our beer. Born & Raised in Washington’s Inland Empire, we’re an internationally award-winning brewery, crafting Spokane-Style beers with No Boundaries: innovative beers made in Spokane, by Spokane residents, using ingredients sourced from within 300 miles of Spokane. We create beers that push ourselves & No-Li drinkers beyond the boundaries… taking a leap beyond the typical beer-drinking experience, and into a memorable adventure. No Boundaries, No-Li!

The pub features Inland Northwest-style pub food, with an emphasis on "keeping it local." Most of the dishes are created from scratch, and use as many locally sourced ingredients as possible. 

For more information about our beers, brewery & the pub, visit www.nolibrewhouse.com.

breweries.name: I & I Brewing
breweries.description:
We are a very small brewery located in Chino, CA. We are starting out as basically just homebrewers with an outlet to share our beers with others. We brew in very small batches and currently the only place to get our beer is directly from our brewery. This allows us a great deal of freedom in variety of style and recipe selection.
 
One of the main reasons we started I & I was because it was hard to find good fresh beer around. Although there are many great breweries in the surrounding counties, San Bernardino County had very few so we decided to open our own.

data.name: Amber Ale
data.description: American Amber ales are one of the most popular American microbrewed beers. Balanced hop bitterness with malty sweetness and light in body, this is another beer that most can drink for hours on end. This is the beer that will keep you on the dark side…

breweries.name: Appleton Beer Factory
breweries.description:
From the self-performed renovation to the custom-fabricated brew train, Appleton Beer Factory was built to immerse patrons in beer culture & display the brewing process. We’re proud of our beer & want you to witness its journey from tun to tongue.

We have an obvious and delicious priority – beer. Our goal is to put top-notch brew in your glass while putting you in a friendly and fun atmosphere. Appleton Beer Factory beers are crafted to deliver what is so often missing from many beers on the market today – balance. This balance was struck from passionate experimentation by knowledgeable brewers who have focused on respecting the ingredients they use and the people they serve.

breweries.name: Thunderhead Brewing Company
breweries.description: The brewery outgrew the Pub, which is still in Kearney.  Brewing is now done in Axtell, Ne.

locations.name: Thunderhead Brewery #2
locations.hoursOfOperation: Open Daily 11:00am-1:00am.

data.name: Amber Ale
data.description: Our Amber Ale is a slightly sweet beer that focuses on a malty flavor and is very lightly hopped. It is a nice amber to almost red hue. The dominant flavors are caramel, bread or biscuit, and a slightly fruity taste. This beer has a malty aroma with just a hint of hops.

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: Hub City Brewing Co
breweries.description: Set in the heart of the Midwest, the Hub City Brewing Company is located five miles east of the historic town of Oelwein, Iowa. Founded in 1872 on a plot of land nestled amongst the fields, the city served as a hub for three major branches of the Chicago Great Western Railway, earning it the nickname of "Hub City" during the heyday of the railroad. Our beers pay homage to this historic Iowa town and the romantic era of the iron horse.

data.name: Amber Ale
data.description: Hoppier than our two lighter beers and with more body than our others. Amber in color, with bready notes. We have it on tap and on cask. The cask is on an English beer engine where the beer is pumped into the glass as opposed to being forced into the glass via a CO2 tank. Often served at a slightly warmer temperature, this beer offers a less filtered and fresher taste.

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: Moccasin Bend Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Moccasin Bend Brewing Company is located in the historic St. Elmo district of Chattanooga, TN.  We’re at the foot of Lookout Mountain just steps away from the world-famous Incline Railway and very near to the great Moccasin Bend of the Tennessee River. 

MBBC was started by two brewers whose quest for the perfect beer led them to learn the art of brewing.  Chris Hunt and Duncan Guy began their brewing education in the Barley Mob Brewers homebrewing club and continued to search for unique and distinctive ale and lager formulas. They decided to offer their creations to the public through a small batch microbrewery in 2006.  Soon thereafter, award-winning brewer Courtney Tyvand joined the two and presented his smoked porter at the brewery’s first beer dinner in October of 2006.

The brewery is located on the ground floor of a historic building at 4015 Tennessee Avenue in St. Elmo.  The building is constructed of foot-square cedar timbers and two-foot thick walls made of granite stone and mortar.  Built in 1911 as a packaging factory for K-Rations for WWI, we occasionally find artifacts from that era in the building walls and ceiling.  The brewery shares space with the Chattanooga U-Brew, a brew-on-premises business owned by Greg McCort. 

MBBC is proud to offer small batch specialty ales and lagers in kegs of various sizes.  A tasting room is part of the brewery; samples of our beers can be tasted and tested on premises.  Occasionally we have tasting events or tapping events at the brewery or at a nearby bar or restaurant.  Please check our calendar for scheduled tasting events at the brewery.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale

breweries.name: Mission Brewery
breweries.description:
Originally located less than a mile from the very hill where Friar Junipero Serra and his scurvy-ridden crew drove their stake into the ground, Mission Brewery was born in those heady first days of the 20th century. And then prohibition shut it down. Re-established in 2007, we are honored to say that four months and four beers in, Mission was awarded two national medals at the Great American Beer Festival. Fast forward to 2010 our plunder of precious beer medals has gown considerably. Three Gold, three Silver and two Bronze medals now fill our bounty. A dream come true for long-time die-hard home brewers. From modest beginnings to a state of the art custom made brewery in the historic Wonderbread building just east of San Diego’s baseball stadium Petco Park. Our brewery should be brewing beer with in the month. Soon therafter our tasting bar will be open to the public. There’s nothing more enjoyable than a pint while watching the beer you’re drinking being made a few feet from where you’re sitting.
No catchy gimmicks. No national campaigns. Just great handcrafted beer made in San Diego!
